Field Detail

SELECTION_SCOPE

public static final String SELECTION_SCOPE
This will be used to create the value of the radio button of the list row as following: [listId].[SELECTION_SCOPE].[rowRequestId]. Note that the submitted radio button value will be later used to look up the row.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ListRowRadioButtonHtmlTag

public ListRowRadioButtonHtmlTag()

doStartTag

protected int doStartTag(Writer out)
                  throws Exception

Internal callback: before tag.

Overrides:
doStartTag in class PresentationTag
Parameters:
out - The writer to be written to.
Throws:
Exception - Any exception.

getRadioButtonValue

protected String getRadioButtonValue()
                              throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Generates the radio button value. It is important that the list widget could later understand it as a selected value.

Returns:
The value that will be used for the radio button.
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException - This method requires listId and rowRequestId entries from the context.

getRadioButtonName

protected String getRadioButtonName()
                             throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Generates the radio button name that should be the same for all radio buttons in one group. This implementation returns [listId].[SELECTION_SCOPE].

Returns:
[listId].[SELECTION_SCOPE]
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException

isSelected

protected boolean isSelected()
                      throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
Decides whether the radio button should be rendered selected or not. It will always be rendered selected when checked is true. Otherwise, it checks using the list view model whether row had been selected before.

Returns:
A Boolean indicating whether the row should be rendered as selected.
Throws:
javax.servlet.jsp.JspException - This method need row request ID and list view model from the JSP context.

getOnclickScript

protected String getOnclickScript()
Description copied from class: BaseListRowControlTag
Provides "onclick" event script for the control. If none specified then null should be returned. Note that the script is used also for Aranea events.

Specified by:
getOnclickScript in class BaseListRowControlTag
Returns:
The script or null.
